comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Douglas EA-3B Skywarrior 144854 of VQ-1. Tail code NG of Carrier Air Wing Nine (CVW-9) Modex side code 010. Marked USS KITTY HAWK & VQ-1 on rear fuselage. Go here for same ref to EA-3B '010': www.vpnavy.com/vq1_aircraft.html (use slider to scroll all way down page to entry and link to small picture same as 'flickr' pic above) 'VQ-1 Aircraft' "...EA-3B Skywarrior from VQ-1 in flight circa 1987. Note: "NG" on the tail denotes the carrier air wing to which the VQ detachment was assigned and is not the squadron designator. 010 was attached to USS KITTY HAWK (CV 63) at the time of this photo. Photo from the Defense Visual Information Center www.dodmedia.osd.mil/dvic/...&quot Contributed by Mahlon K. Miller mkwsmiller@cox.net [19MAY2001] From my personal notes on EA-3B Skywarrior 144854; Originally built as A3D-2Q Accepted by US Navy November 1959 From 1962 re-designated EA-3B For all its working life EA-3B 144854 was assigned to VQ-1 'World Watchers'. Tragically this aircraft was lost on 26 June 1987, killing all crew members. EA-3B 144854 assigned to VQ-1 & recorded as PR Modex 10 in 1963 at Atsugi Japan. geta-o.maxs.jp/USMIL/A/A-3/EA-3B/EA-3B.htm geta-o.maxs.jp/USMIL/A/A-3/EA-3B/144854(pr10)ea-3b-0164.jpg Article specifically mentioning EA-3B 144854 as Modex 10 in 1963: www.coldwar.org/museum/ea3b.asp "Our two aircraft were known as Sun-1 (PR-9 BuNo 146449) and Sun-2 (PR-10 BuNo 144854)." Picture of EA-3B 144854 PR-15 dated Aug 1971. NAS Atsugi Japan www.vpnavy.com/misc_13/vq1ea3_01_28feb2007.jpg EA-3B 144854 flew the last combat mission flown out of DaNang Viet Nam by the VQ-1 squadron detachment on 'TASES' assignment. Date - Feb. 1, 1973. Flight code 1R5. marked as PR-15 www.flickr.com/photos/johnvphipps/4219465706/ There is a 1977 reference to an EA-3B of VQ-1 using Modex 010: www.gonavy.jp/CV-CV63-01f.html (my thanks to Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval aviation historian) CVW-9 (tail code NG). CV-64 USS CONSTELLATION April 12, 1977 to Nov.21, 1977 . WestPac deployment www.gonavy.jp/CVW9-NG1977.html VQ-1 DET. (EA-3B) (tail code PR) Modex '010' Bu No 144854. Photo webpage of A-3’s plus one of EA-3B 144854: www.gonavy.jp/bbs2-a3.html (click on each to view) EA-3B PR-010/VQ-1 (Oct.16, 1977) 1982 ref to EA-3B 144854: www.gonavy.jp/CVW2-NE1982.html CVW-2 (NE) CV-61 USS RANGER April 7 to Oct 18, 1982 (WestPac, Indian Ocean) VQ-1 DET. (EA-3B) PR-007 144854 Research of 'GO!NAVY' website reveals that during 1985 three Seventh Fleet Pacific Ocean base carriers deployed with VQ-1 aircraft attached. The Kitty Hawk, Constellation and Carl Vinson. There are records for VQ-1 EA-3B Modex '005' Bu No 146457 aboard two of them, but nothing for '010'. Here is a 1986 reference that some time between Jan & Dec.1986 EA-3B Skywarrior Modex 010 of VQ-1DET.A was attached to CVW-5 (code NF) when the air wing was permanently assigned to forward deployed CV-41 USS MIDWAY www.gonavy.jp/CVW5-NF1986-1.html (Jan.1986 - Dec.1986) VQ-1 DET.A (EA-3B) Modex 010 is recorded as Bu No 144854. Other ‘flickr’ pics of EA-3B Modex 010 of VQ-1 may be viewed here: www.flickr.com/photos/24916500@N05/3087576205/ www.flickr.com/photos/tubagua/4667599055/ Here may be found a record of the loss of EA-3B 144854 on 28 June 1987; A-3 Skywarrior accident/loss list: www.a3skywarrior.com/memorial/full_accident_date.htm VQ-1 DET. EA-3B Bu No 144854. Tail code PR. Modex '010'. Crashed during night FCLP at NAS Miramar. 3 fatalities Pilot Lt. Daniel Smith, NAV Lt. David Madison, ATAN Herb Plath Whilst practicing Field Carrier Landing Practice at NAS Miramar aircraft impacted the ground after turning downwind subsequent to take off. Destroyed/Lost in ground collision. 26 June 1987 My respects to the crew, families or friends.
